episodes.title: Transference Focused Psychotherapy & Personality Disorders with Dr. Otto Kernberg
episodes.description:

05:49 Early Influences

30:24 Sexual Life in Borderline and Narcissistic Personality
45:08 Transference-Focused Psychotherapy and Reflective Function
1:03:52 Histrionic Personality
1:09:35 Paranoid Personality
1:11:19 Schizoid Personality
1:18:37 Why Therapists Want to Help

In this insightful interview, Dr. Otto Kernberg, renowned psychiatrist and pioneer of Transference-Focused Psychotherapy (TFP), shares profound insights into personality disorders, including Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD), narcissistic, schizoid, paranoid, and histrionic personalities.

Dr. Kernberg explores core psychoanalytic concepts such as identity diffusion, primitive defense mechanisms (splitting, projective identification), and the dynamics of sexuality and aggression within personality disorders. Learn how Transference-Focused Psychotherapy uniquely enhances reflective functioning and emotional integration, transforming patient outcomes.

Essential viewing for therapists, psychology students, and anyone interested in deepening their understanding of personality structure, psychoanalytic theory, and effective psychotherapy approaches.
